results:
Based on my search results, I found some information about Polish reception of "Pride and Prejudice" by Jane Austen, though the specific academic analysis comparing English and Polish 19th-century nobility appears limited in the search results. Here's what I found:

## Polish Reception of Pride and Prejudice

The novel shows "realia angielskiego życia na przełomie XVIII/XIX wieku" (realities of English life at the turn of the 18th/19th century), which Polish readers have found particularly compelling. Polish critics have praised "Kunszt pisarski Jane Austen" (Jane Austen's literary artistry) and the novel's enduring appeal.

## Social Class Themes Relevant to Polish Context

The search results reveal several social themes that would resonate with Polish nobility (szlachta):

The book depicts "świat, w którym uroda i status społeczny stanowią najwyższe wartości" (a world where beauty and social status constitute the highest values). This creates "szara rzeczywistość pełna konwenansów, w której rozmowy towarzyskie sprowadzają się do pustych komplementów i uprzejmości" (a gray reality full of conventions, where social conversations come down to empty compliments and politeness).

The novel shows how "Class plays a central role in the evolution of the characters", which would parallel the hierarchical nature of Polish szlachta society.

## 19th Century Social Parallels

The novel captures "atmosferze prowincjonalnej XIX-wiecznej Anglii" (the atmosphere of provincial 19th-century England) and presents "Fascynujący obraz stosunków społecznych w świecie ulegającym wpływom nowoczesności i jednocześnie hołdującym dawnym obyczajom" (a fascinating picture of social relations in a world succumbing to modern influences while simultaneously honoring old customs).

Polish descriptions emphasize the novel as "Błyskotliwe połączenie portretu szlachty angielskiej początku XIX wieku" (a brilliant combination of a portrait of English nobility from the early 19th century).

While the search results provide insights into Polish appreciation of the novel's social commentary and class dynamics, they don't contain detailed academic analysis specifically comparing Polish szlachta with English gentry of the period. For more specialized scholarly work on these social parallels, academic databases focusing on comparative literature or Polish literary criticism would likely yield more comprehensive results.
